courses.title: Vibe Coding 101
courses.shortDescription: Learn How to build production ready apps with the aid of generative A.I and Large Language models
courses.fullDescription:
Course Goal: Equip learners with the practical skills and conceptual understanding to effectively use AI-assisted Vibe Coding tools to build software prototypes and small applications, while fostering essential software development best practices and critical thinking about AI's role in coding.

LMS Integration & Best Practices :

Modular Structure: Content broken into logical modules with clear weekly goals.
Clear Learning Objectives: Each module and lesson starts with specific, measurable objectives.
Mixed Media: Utilize video lectures (demos, explanations), text readings (summaries, concepts, links), code snippets, screencasts, and potentially interactive simulations (if platform allows).

Hands-On Practice: Frequent coding exercises, quizzes (knowledge checks), and progressively larger assignments.
Capstone Project: A significant project to synthesize learning.

Facilitator Guidance: Specific notes for facilitators on guiding discussions, common pitfalls, and adapting content.
Community Forum: Essential for Q&A, peer support, and discussion prompts initiated by the facilitator.

Assessment: Mix of automated quizzes, peer-reviewed assignments (optional but good for scale), and facilitator-graded project milestones/final submission.

Supplemental Resources: Curated links to official documentation, relevant articles, community resources, and further learning paths.

Accessibility: Provide transcripts for videos, use clear language, consider offline access strategies if relevant to the target audience's connectivity.
learningOutcomes: Compare and select appropriate Vibe Coding tools based on needs and resources.
Install or access chosen tools (Windsurf, Cursor, Replit, VS Code + Extension).
Set up a basic project environment locally or online.

modules.title: Tools & Setup (Week 1)
modules.description:
Learning Objectives:
Compare and select appropriate Vibe Coding tools based on needs and resources.
Install or access chosen tools (Windsurf, Cursor, Replit, VS Code + Extension).
Set up a basic project environment locally or online.
Lesson 1.1: Exploring the Toolbox
Video: Demo walkthrough of key tools: Windsurf/Cursor (IDE-like), Replit (Online), VS Code + AI Extension (Integration), AI Canvases (Claude/ChatGPT - for quick tests). Pros/Cons discussion (Offline vs Online, Cost, Features).
Reading: Comparison chart of tools, links to download/access pages. Focus on free tiers/options.
Activity: Tool Selection Guide (simple questionnaire helping learners choose).
Lesson 1.2: Installation & Setup
Video/Screencast: Guided installation for one primary tool (e.g., Windsurf or VS Code + Extension). Separate brief guide for Replit signup.
Reading: Step-by-step text guides with screenshots. Basic terminal commands if needed (checking Python/Node versions).
Activity: Setup Check - Learners post a screenshot or confirmation of their setup in the forum.
Lesson 1.3: Your First Interaction
Video: Simple "Hello World" equivalent using the chosen tool's AI chat/write feature. Understanding the basic interface.
Activity: Guided exercise - Generate a simple HTML page or Python script using an AI prompt.
Quiz: Tool features, setup steps.
Facilitator Note: Address setup issues proactively in forums. Highlight Replit as a strong option for lower-spec machines or inconsistent internet.

modules.title: Planning & Prompting (Week 2)
modules.description:
Learning Objectives:
Understand the critical importance of planning before coding.
Utilize AI assistance to generate project plans (PRD) and to-do lists.
Craft clear, effective prompts for AI code generation.
Select appropriate programming languages/stacks for common project types.
Lesson 2.1: The Power of the Plan
Video: Why planning is more important in VC. Demo using Claude/Grok/ChatGPT to brainstorm and structure a simple app idea (e.g., a "Naija Recipe Finder"). Creating a PRD (Product Requirements Document) and a todo.md.
Reading: Template for a simple PRD, article on breaking down problems.
Activity: Planning Exercise - Learners choose a simple app idea and use an AI to generate a basic PRD and to-do list. Submit for peer/facilitator feedback.
Lesson 2.2: Prompt Engineering for Coders
Video: Best practices for prompting AI for code: Be specific, provide context (existing code snippets, file structure), define desired output format, iterate on prompts. Show examples of good vs. bad prompts.
Reading: Prompting cheatsheet, examples specific to code generation.
Activity: Prompt Practice - Given a scenario, write effective prompts.
Lesson 2.3: Choosing Your Language & Stack
Video: Why popular languages (JavaScript, Python) work well with AI. Common stacks (Python/Flask/Django backend + JS/HTML frontend, or full-stack JS with Node/React). How to tell the AI your chosen stack.
Reading: Overview of JS/Python strengths, GitHut 2.0 resource.
Quiz: Planning process, prompting techniques, language choices.
Facilitator Note: Emphasize iteration in planning and prompting. Review submitted plans for clarity and feasibility.

modules.title: Build, Test, Commit (Week 3-4)
modules.description:
Learning Objectives:
Execute the iterative Vibe Coding workflow: Plan -> Prompt AI -> Build Feature -> Prompt AI for Tests -> Run Tests -> Debug -> Commit Code.
Utilize version control (Git/GitHub) to save progress and manage changes effectively.
Understand the necessity of testing AI-generated code.
Perform basic debugging of AI-generated code using AI assistance and test results.
Lesson 3.1: Introducing the Workflow
Video: Detailed explanation and visualization of the Build -> Test -> Commit -> Repeat cycle. Emphasize building small features one at a time.
Lesson 3.2: Your First Feature Cycle (Guided)
Video/Screencast: Facilitator walks through building the first feature from the planning exercise app (e.g., basic HTML structure for Recipe Finder). Showing prompt, AI response, manual review.
Activity: Learners follow along, building the first feature of their planned app.
Lesson 3.3: Version Control Essentials: Git & GitHub
Video: Deep dive into Git basics (init, add, commit, status, log). Setting up a GitHub repository and pushing code (remote add origin, push). Why this is crucial for VC (rollback!). Using AI to generate .gitignore.
Reading: Git cheatsheet, GitHub setup guide.
Activity: Git Practice - Initialize Git, make commits for the first feature, create GitHub repo, push code. Submit GitHub link.
Lesson 3.4: Testing Your AI Buddy's Work
Video: Why test AI code? Demo asking the AI to write simple tests (e.g., Python unittest or basic JS checks) for the feature built. Running the tests, interpreting pass/fail.
Reading: Introduction to testing concepts (Unit tests).
Activity: Generate and run tests for the first feature.
Lesson 3.5: Debugging with AI Assistance
Video: What to do when tests fail or code doesn't work. Feeding error messages back to the AI, asking for explanations, asking for fixes. Rolling back using Git if necessary (git revert or git reset - explain difference carefully).
Activity: Introduce a deliberate small bug (or use a common AI error example) and have learners practice debugging with AI help.
Assignment: Build the next 1-2 features of the planned app, following the full workflow (Build, Test, Commit with Git/GitHub). Submit GitHub link for review.
Quiz: Git commands, testing purpose, workflow steps.
Facilitator Note: This is the core practical module. Expect many questions. Encourage use of forums. Review GitHub repos for proper commit history and testing attempts. Emphasize that debugging is a key skill even with VC.

modules.title: Rules, UI & Security Basics (Week 5)
modules.description:
Learning Objectives:
Configure AI agent rules to enforce coding standards and workflows.
Integrate pre-built UI templates/libraries for better front-end design.
Implement fundamental security and maintainability practices.
Use AI for code refactoring and security audits.
Lesson 4.1: Guiding Your AI: Agent Rules
Video: Explaining "Rules" in tools like Windsurf/Cursor. Demo setting global vs. workspace rules (e.g., "always use f-strings in Python," "keep functions short," "prefer existing patterns"). Finding rule sets online (Awesome Cursor Rules repo).
Reading: Examples of useful rules.
Activity: Configure 2-3 basic rules in their chosen tool.
Lesson 4.2: Making it Look Good: UI Templates
Video: Why AI struggles with complex UI. Demo finding a free Bootstrap/Tailwind template, downloading it, adding it to the project, and instructing the AI to use its components/styles for the front-end.
Reading: Links to free template resources.
Activity: Integrate a simple UI template into their ongoing project.
Lesson 4.3: Secure & Maintainable Code Hygiene
Video: Critical security basics: NEVER commit API keys/secrets (use .gitignore, environment variables - simple explanation), basic input validation concept, rate limiting idea (awareness). Maintainability: Ask AI to add comments, refactor long functions, check for code duplication. Demo asking AI for a basic security audit/review.
Reading: Security best practices checklist (simplified), article on code maintainability. OWASP Top 10 awareness (very high level).
Activity: Security/Maintainability Check - Run through a checklist for their project (e.g., check .gitignore, ask AI to refactor one function).
Quiz: Rules purpose, UI integration steps, key security pitfalls.
Facilitator Note: Balance detail with accessibility. Focus on awareness of security/maintainability, not deep expertise. Show how AI can help with these practices.

modules.title: Vibe Your Vision (Week 6-7)
modules.description:
Learning Objectives:
Independently apply the Vibe Coding workflow to build a complete small application from planning to basic deployment (optional).
Demonstrate proficiency in using AI tools, Git, testing, and basic quality practices.
Troubleshoot and iterate on an AI-assisted project.
Lesson 5.1: Project Kick-off & Scoping
Video: Introducing the capstone project. Learners choose from a list of ideas (e.g., Portfolio Website, Simple CRUD App, API Data Visualizer, Basic Game) or propose their own (subject to facilitator approval). Emphasize realistic scoping.
Reading: Project descriptions, grading rubric.
Activity: Submit project proposal and initial plan (using AI assist) for facilitator feedback.
Lesson 5.2: Project Work & Milestones
(No new lecture content - focus on application)
Activity: Weeks dedicated to project work. Learners follow the Build-Test-Commit loop, using forums and potentially live Q&A sessions with the facilitator for support.
Milestone 1 (End Week 6): Basic structure, core feature(s) working, Git history visible. Submit GitHub link.
Milestone 2 (End Week 7): Most features implemented, tests included, basic UI/Security considered. Final GitHub link submission + optional short video demo/write-up.
Facilitator Note: Provide active support during project weeks. Encourage peer feedback. Focus rubric on the process (planning, Git usage, testing attempts, iteration) as much as the final output. Offer optional guidance on simple deployment (Replit, Netlify, GitHub Pages).

modules.title: Ethics & Future Vibes (Week 8)
modules.description:
Learning Objectives:
Discuss the evolving landscape of AI in software development and its potential impact.
Reflect on the ethical considerations of using AI for coding (bias, ownership, job displacement).
Identify pathways for continued learning in software development and AI.
Lesson 6.1: The Future of Code & Careers
Video: Discussing current trends (more capable AI models, agentic systems), how roles might shift (more focus on architecture, testing, prompt engineering, AI oversight). Vibe Coding as a skill amplifier.
Reading: Articles on the future of software engineering with AI.
Lesson 6.2: Ethical Considerations & Responsible Use
Video: Discussing potential bias in AI-generated code, data privacy implications, code ownership questions, plagiarism concerns, the importance of transparency.
Reading: Articles on AI ethics in tech.
Discussion Forum: "How should developers use AI coding tools responsibly? What ethical guidelines are needed?" (Facilitator leads).
Lesson 6.3: Your Next Steps
Video: Encouragement, highlighting skills learned. Suggesting next steps: dive deeper into specific languages (JS/Python), frameworks (React, Django), cloud platforms, traditional coding fundamentals, contributing to open source.
Reading: Curated list of resources for further learning (specific courses, docs, communities relevant to African tech scene).
Activity: Personal Learning Plan - Learners outline 2-3 skills they want to develop next.
Course Wrap-up: Final remarks, course survey/feedback request.

courses.title: Cybersecurity
courses.shortDescription: An essential introduction to the world of cybersecurity, covering core concepts, common threats, defensive measures, operational security, and ethical considerations.
courses.fullDescription: This course provides a comprehensive overview of the fundamental principles and practices of cybersecurity. Students will learn about the core security concepts (Confidentiality, Integrity, Availability), identify common threats like malware and phishing, understand defensive technologies such as firewalls and encryption, and explore operational aspects like incident response and security policies. The course also delves into the critical ethical and legal considerations within the field. Ideal for individuals starting their cybersecurity journey, IT professionals seeking security knowledge, or anyone wanting to understand how to protect digital assets.
learningOutcomes: Define cybersecurity and its importance in the modern digital world
Explain the core goals of cybersecurity: Confidentiality, Integrity, and Availability (CIA Triad).
Identify key terminology (threat, vulnerability, risk, asset, countermeasure).
Recognize major historical cybersecurity events and their impact.
Understand the different types of threat actors and their motivations.

modules.title: Common Threats and Vulnerabilities
modules.description:
Learning Outcomes:
Identify and describe common types of malware (viruses, worms, ransomware, spyware, trojans).
Explain various social engineering techniques (phishing, spear phishing, vishing, baiting).
Describe common network-based attacks (DoS/DDoS, Man-in-the-Middle).
Recognize basic web application vulnerabilities (e.g., SQL Injection, Cross-Site Scripting - overview).
Understand physical security threats.

content.title: Common Threats and Vulnerabilities
content.description:
Topics Covered:
Perimeter Security: Firewalls (Stateful, Stateless, NGFW, WAF)
Network Monitoring: IDS vs. IPS
Endpoint Security: Antivirus/Anti-malware, Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR - basic concept)
Network Design: Segmentation, DMZs, VLANs, VPNs
Cryptography Basics: Symmetric vs. Asymmetric Encryption, Hashing, Digital Signatures, SSL/TLS
Access Control: Principle of Least Privilege, Authentication Methods (Passwords, MFA), Authorization
Patch Management and Vulnerability Scanning

courses.title: Ecogrow Nigeria: Mastering Sustainable Greenhouse Farming With Ai Insights
courses.shortDescription: Learn Modern, Eco-Friendly Farming Techniques Tailored for Nigeria, Powered by Ecofarms Expertise and AI-Driven Learning.
courses.fullDescription:
Expert Facilitation by Ecofarms: Insights, case studies, best practices, and Q&A sessions led by experienced professionals from Ecofarms.

AI-Powered Learning Path (Conceptual):
Personalized Recommendations: AI suggests supplementary materials or focus areas based on quiz performance.

Data Insights: Demonstrations of how AI tools can analyze climate, soil, and market data for better decision-making (using simulated or real anonymized data examples from Ecofarms).

AI Chatbot Support: A trained chatbot to answer common questions instantly (backed by Ecofarms' knowledge base).

Accessibility: Clear language, video transcripts, downloadable resources for offline access, mobile-friendly design.

Structured Learning: Modular approach with clear objectives, engaging content (videos, readings, simulations), practical assignments, and assessments.

o equip learners with the knowledge, practical skills, and business acumen to establish and manage a sustainable and profitable greenhouse farm in the Nigerian context, leveraging modern techniques and AI-driven insights facilitated by Ecofarms.

To equip learners with the knowledge, practical skills, and business acumen to establish and manage a sustainable and profitable greenhouse farm in the Nigerian context, leveraging modern techniques and AI-driven insights facilitated by Ecofarms.

Nigerian Context: Content specifically tailored to Nigerian climate zones, soil types, market conditions, regulations, and available resources.

Sustainability Focus: Emphasis on environmental stewardship, resource efficiency (water, energy, nutrients), and economic viability.
learningOutcomes: To equip learners with the knowledge, practical skills, and business acumen to establish and manage a sustainable and profitable greenhouse farm in the Nigerian context, leveraging modern techniques and AI-driven insights facilitated by Ecofarms.
Agribusiness practitioners
A.I enhanced farming
Implementation of sustainable farming practices

modules.description:
Lesson 1.1: Understanding Controlled Environment Agriculture (CEA)
Lesson 1.2: Benefits of Greenhouse Farming vs. Open Field (Yield, Quality, Resource Efficiency)
Lesson 1.3: Key Environmental Factors to Control: Light, Temperature, Humidity, CO2
Lesson 1.4: The Nigerian Context: Climate Zones & Specific Considerations

Ecofarms Insight: Common misconceptions about greenhouse farming in Nigeria.
Activity: Analyze climate data for your region in Nigeria.
Quiz 1: Foundational Concepts.

quiz.title: Foundational Concepts.
quiz.description: Answer all questions correctly to earn course certificate.

questions.text: What is a primary advantage of greenhouse farming compared to open-field agriculture in Nigeria?

options.text: Allows for better control over pests, diseases, and climate factors.
Uses more land area per unit of production.

questions.text: Controlled Environment Agriculture (CEA) refers only to growing crops without soil (hydroponics).
List two essential environmental factors that greenhouse farming allows growers to manage more effectively than open-field farming.
questions.answer: Any two of the following: Temperature, Humidity, Light (intensity/duration), CO2 levels, Protection from wind/heavy rain.

modules.title: Designing & Constructing Your Greenhouse (Week 2)
modules.description:
Lesson 2.1: Site Selection Criteria (Sunlight, Water Access, Topography, Security)
Lesson 2.2: Types of Greenhouse Structures (Tunnel, A-Frame, Sawtooth) - Pros/Cons for Nigeria (Cost vs. Efficiency)
Lesson 2.3: Greenhouse Materials: Glazing (Polyethylene, Polycarbonate, Glass), Framing (Wood, Steel, PVC) - Local Sourcing Options.
Lesson 2.4: Essential Components: Ventilation, Shading, Doors, Foundation.
Lesson 2.5: Costing Your Greenhouse Construction in Nigeria.

Ecofarms Insight: Practical tips for building durable and cost-effective structures in Nigeria.
Assignment 1: Develop a basic greenhouse design sketch and material list for a specific Nigerian climate zone.

Activity: Research market prices for 3 potential greenhouse crops in your local area.

modules.title: Climate Control & Automation Technologies (Week 5)
modules.description:
Lesson 5.1: Managing Temperature: Ventilation (Natural/Forced), Shading, Cooling Systems (Evaporative).
Lesson 5.2: Managing Humidity: Techniques and Importance.
Lesson 5.3: Light Management: Supplemental Lighting (if needed), Photoperiod Control.
Lesson 5.4: Introduction to Sensors and Monitoring Tools (Manual vs. Automated).
Lesson 5.5: Basic Automation Options for Small-Scale Greenhouses in Nigeria.

AI Spotlight: How sensor data + AI can optimize climate control & predict potential issues (Demo/Simulation).
Ecofarms Insight: Cost-effective climate control strategies for different budgets.
Quiz 3: Climate Control Principles.

modules.title: Sustainable Water Management & Irrigation (Week 6)
modules.description:
Lesson 6.1: Water Sources and Quality Assessment in Nigeria.
Lesson 6.2: Water Conservation Strategies: Rainwater Harvesting, Water Recycling.
Lesson 6.3: Efficient Irrigation Systems: Drip Irrigation, Fertigation.
Lesson 6.4: Calculating Crop Water Requirements.
Lesson 6.5: Monitoring Water Usage and System Maintenance.

Ecofarms Insight: Setting up and maintaining drip irrigation with locally available parts.
Assignment 2: Calculate the estimated daily water requirement for a small greenhouse plot.

modules.title: Integrated Pest & Disease Management (IPM) (Week 7)
modules.description:
Lesson 7.1: Principles of Sustainable IPM.
Lesson 7.2: Common Pests and Diseases in Nigerian Greenhouses.
Lesson 7.3: Prevention & Monitoring Strategies (Scouting, Sanitation, Resistant Varieties).
Lesson 7.4: Biological Control Methods.
Lesson 7.5: Cultural & Physical Controls.
Lesson 7.6: Judicious Use of Organic/Low-Impact Pesticides (Last Resort).

AI Spotlight: Potential for AI in early pest/disease detection via image analysis (Conceptual overview).
Ecofarms Insight: Practical IPM schedules and interventions used at Ecofarms.
Quiz 4: IPM Strategies.

modules.title: Harvest, Post-Harvest & Market Linkages (Week 8)
modules.description:
Lesson 8.1: Determining Harvest Readiness & Proper Harvesting Techniques.
Lesson 8.2: Post-Harvest Handling: Cleaning, Sorting, Grading.
Lesson 8.3: Packaging and Storage for Extended Shelf Life.
Lesson 8.4: Understanding Nigerian Food Safety Standards & Quality Requirements.
Lesson 8.5: Identifying Market Channels (Direct Sales, Retail, Wholesale, Hospitality).

Ecofarms Insight: Building relationships with buyers and navigating market logistics in Nigeria.
Activity: Develop a simple post-harvest handling plan for a chosen crop.

modules.title: Economics, Business Planning & Record Keeping (Week 9)
modules.description:
Lesson 9.1: Estimating Start-up and Operational Costs.
Lesson 9.2: Revenue Projections and Profitability Analysis.
Lesson 9.3: Developing a Simple Greenhouse Business Plan.
Lesson 9.4: Importance of Record Keeping (Yields, Inputs, Sales, Expenses).
Lesson 9.5: Accessing Finance: Loans, Grants, and Investment Opportunities in Nigeria.
AI Spotlight: Using simple tools (or AI-powered projections) for financial forecasting.
Ecofarms Insight: Key financial metrics Ecofarms tracks for success.
Assignment 3: Create a basic budget outline for a small greenhouse operation.

modules.title: The Future: Scaling, AI & Continuous Improvement (Week 10)
modules.description:
Lesson 10.1: Scaling Your Greenhouse Operation: Considerations and Steps.
Lesson 10.2: Deeper Dive into AI Applications: Predictive Analytics, Resource Optimization, Market Trend Analysis.
Lesson 10.3: Staying Updated: Continuous Learning and Innovation in CEA.
Lesson 10.4: Building a Network & Community of Practice in Nigeria.
Ecofarms Insight: Future trends Ecofarms is watching in Nigerian agriculture.

Final Project: Submit a comprehensive Sustainable Greenhouse Farming Plan (incorporating elements from all modules).
Course Evaluation Survey.
